intro: Scabiosa collina, commonly known as the upright scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing showy, five-petaled flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scabiosa collina prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and meadows. Its foliage is usually gray-green with hairy leaves, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
